abstract: New York City Police Commissioner William J Bratton embraces neighborhood policing approach as central part of his forthcoming 'plan of action' for changes to department; approach will involve assigning hundreds of new officers to fixed areas of their precinct and give them time to focus on community concerns without being interrupted by 911 calls.
lead_paragraph: The extra officers afforded by the budget agreement this week will allow officers to focus on community concerns without being interrupted by 911 calls, William J. Bratton, the commissioner, said.

headline.main: Neighborhood Policing to Expand Across New York, Bratton Says
headline.print_headline: Larger Force Will Embrace Neighborhood Policing Plan, Bratton Says

snippet: The extra officers afforded by the budget agreement this week will allow officers to focus on community concerns without being interrupted by 911 calls, William J. Bratton, the commissioner, said.
